other_tests.findings: Pathological and cytologic examination of the biopsy specimen revealed a giant-cell tumor of bone.

other_tests.date: 6 days after the first stage of surgery
other_tests.findings: Embolization was performed to decrease vascularity in preparation for resection of the giant-cell tumor.

other_tests.date: Second stage surgery performed 6 days after the first stage
other_tests.findings: En bloc excision of the tumor with sparing of the nerve roots; reconstruction of the vertebral body with expandable spinal-segment cage.
The recurrent tumor of the lumbar spine was treated with a cumulative dose of 58 Gy at 2 Gy per fraction; the duodenal metastasis was treated with 56 Gy at 2 Gy per fraction.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Follow-up CT revealed a decrease in size of the L5â€“S1 mass of more than 50% and a reduction in the size of the duodenal metastasis of more than 80%.

other_tests.date: Five months after completion of radiotherapy
other_tests.findings: The requirement for narcotics for pain control decreased, and no new lesions subsequently developed.
other_tests.changes_over_time: The lung nodule has remained stable in size.
